alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Madison (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Madison and central Hamilton Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 529 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Noblesville, or 18 miles north of Indianapolis, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fishers and Noblesville around 540 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
